column18: 11/12/2007: Unidentified gunmen in speedboats attacked a Cameroonian military post on the Bakassi Peninsula, Cameroon. The gunmen killed 21 soldiers, and the soldiers' return of fire killed 10 attackers.
column64: Authorities speculated that the Nigerian militants may have wanted to provoke a Cameroonian response against the Nigerian government.
column129: 2007.\",\"\"\"Cameroon: Government Says Unidentified Gunmen Attack Soldiers"
column136: 06/09/2008: On Monday in Bakassi, Cameroon, unknown gunmen abducted the Deputy Governor of the Bakassi, killing three police officers in the process. No group claimed responsibility. The status of the Deputy Governor is unknown.
column182: The specific motive for the attack is unknown.
column215: Unknown firearms were used in the attack.
column226: It is unknown if the attack caused any property damage.
column250: \"\"Nigeria; Cameroonian Deputy Governor Abducted in Bakassi\"\""

column18: 04/06/1998: A bomb exploded in the center of Banio, Cameroon, causing significant damage to several public and administrative buildings. There were no casualties reported and the assailants were unknown.
column108: Several administrative and public buildings were damaged.
column126: \\"\"Cameroon - Bomb Blast Rocks Town Near Nigerian Border"
